Pre-Game Insights: Both Argentina and Colombia have large expatriate communities in South Florida, making the final feel like a home game for both teams.
Large numbers of Colombians began settling in South Florida in the 1980s, often fleeing violence, while many Argentines arrived in the 1970s and 1990s due to economic turmoil.
Soccer has become a significant part of the local culture, with increased interest in youth soccer among parents seeking to get their children into the sport.

The political landscape in South Florida has shifted, with both Argentine and Colombian Americans leaning more conservative, providing an opportunity for political campaigns to engage with these communities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hard Rock Stadium will host seven World Cup matches in 2026.
The average ticket price for the Copa Am√©rica final was nearly $1,300 each on the secondary market.
Inter Miami, a Major League Soccer franchise, has helped drive the growth of soccer in South Florida, with a $10 million training facility planned in North Bay Village.
